channel.title: Whats the difference between a desktop harddrive and a laptop harddrive?
channel.description:
On Newegg, laptop hard drives are barely 300 GB max, which is completely fine to me as I'm running 40 GB now. But for a little bit extra money, you can get a [url=http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16822136131]750 GB[/url] drive. Couldn't I could run this out of my laptop and save some money and get the extra space? Like an external hard drive, I suppose.
This the laptop would be $600 US, because it was 400 when I got it and the new drive. How large of a RAM upgrade could I get to keep it under $800?

item.title: Whats the difference between a desktop harddrive and a laptop harddrive?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Does your laptop have a Firewire port?
If it does, check out Firewire/USB comparisons… http://www.usb-ware.com/firewire-vs-usb.htm for one.

Read full topic
item.source: Whats the difference between a desktop harddrive and a laptop harddrive?

item.title: Whats the difference between a desktop harddrive and a laptop harddrive?
item.dc:creator: @LegendaryLoser .Flair
item.description:
@LegendaryLoser wrote:

I can use my laptops drive if I need to go portable, but for the most part it’s used it my room like a desktop. I’ll look into Firewire.

Read full topic
item.source: Whats the difference between a desktop harddrive and a laptop harddrive?

item.title: Whats the difference between a desktop harddrive and a laptop harddrive?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=".Flair, post:11, topic:134094"]Thanks for the info. If I’m reading right I think I’m getting mixed responses…

I have Windows XP Media Center Edition and it’s a Compaq if that helps.[/quote]

From my understanding, you have a few choices:

  1. Buy a legit laptop harddrive. (Recommended, though may be slower.)
  2. Buy an external harddrive. (May be faster, but bottlenecked by USB/Firewire, may not work correctly, and clunky to carry around.)

Read full topic
item.source: Whats the difference between a desktop harddrive and a laptop harddrive?

item.title: Whats the difference between a desktop harddrive and a laptop harddrive?
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:2, topic:134094”]The problem is, can the BIOS handle such a huge amount of space? The main difference is size, laptop hard drives are ridiculously smaller than normal hard drives, and usually have less rpm(5400 compared to 7200, this determine how fast the hard drive can move files, delete them or whatever).

On another note, I don’t think you can use a hard drive as an external one.[/quote]

actually, ive seen something that does that but i dont remember where…

Read full topic
item.source: Whats the difference between a desktop harddrive and a laptop harddrive?

item.title: Whats the difference between a desktop harddrive and a laptop harddrive?
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

Having more than one account is against the rules, but you’re right. xD

Uhh, I remember vaguely modifying an external hard drive enclosure to use laptop hard drives but I don’t think that will help you here. Regular HD’s won’t work with a laptop without an external HD enclosure.

item.source: Whats the difference between a desktop harddrive and a laptop harddrive?

item.title: Whats the difference between a desktop harddrive and a laptop harddrive?
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

I don’t completly understand you.
Do you want to put a 3.5" harddrive in your laptop? Or do you want to put it into an external drive and boot from it?
The first thing is impossible, the second thing is. However it differs each computer, you shoud look into the bios if you can boot from USB. (Firewire is mostly not supported! Unless you have a mac ;))
If so, then you can boot from it, otherwise you can only use it as a data drive.

Read full topic
item.source: Whats the difference between a desktop harddrive and a laptop harddrive?

item.title: Whats the difference between a desktop harddrive and a laptop harddrive?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

The problem is, can the BIOS handle such a huge amount of space? The main difference is size, laptop hard drives are ridiculously smaller than normal hard drives, and usually have less rpm(5400 compared to 7200, this determine how fast the hard drive can move files, delete them or whatever).

On another note, I don’t think you can use a hard drive as an external one.

Read full topic
